name: Sherry
snippet: Sherry is a fortified wine made from white grapes that are grown near the town of Jerez de la Frontera in Andalusia, Spain. Finos are brilliant aperitifs; old olorosos are best at the other end of the meal.
HowToServe: Fino and manzarilla, and the sweetned pale sherries, should be served very well chilled, preferably from a fresh opened bottle.
